name: SGB Link
description: Add a link port to your Super Game Boy cartridge with this easy to install kit.

name: PS2 jack
description: This PS2 type din socket will allow you to plug in an old PS2 keyboard to your Original Game Boy to use as a musical keyboard with LSDJ.

name: NES Style Arduino Boy
description:
At Thursday Customs we're always working towards improving our products. 
With the redesign of our NES Style Arduino Boy we're using higher quality components and we've given it a minimalistic new look. 
At first glance the "invisible" LEDs, flush MIDI sockets and link port cover make this Arduino Boy look just like a standard NES controller. 
The mode switch is now both "A"+"B" buttons making sure you to never accidentally switch modes at the wrong time. 
All the features from the original version remain intact.
Features:
MIDI in/out
Powered via DMG link cable
"Invisible" white status/mode LEDs
All buttons maintain original tactile feeling
'A' + 'B' buttons act as mode switch(press both at the same time)
Link port for syncing additional Game Boy(choose type in the drop down menu)
7 modes. in order: 
  LSDJ slave sync
  LSDJ master sync
  LSDJ keyboard
  Nanoloop
  MidiGB
  LSDJ map
  LSDJ MIDI out

*DISCLAIMER* 
These units are made-to-order. There is a waiting list.
Therefor please allow up to 45 days for the item to be assembled. 
Shipping is then 2-3 business days in the US or 6-10 business days international(though they can sometimes be delayed in customs so please be patient. 
Feel free to contact me if this time frame has passed. Also be aware that international orders can be subject to import/customs fees).

name: USB-to-GameBoy power cables
description:
These cables are for powering an Original Game Boy(DMG) via standard USB bus power (USB type A connector).

Just plug right into your computer or a USB power supply and ditch the batteries!

The DC plug is at a right-angle to decrease the tension on the DC jack and to help prevent slippage during use.

**these cables do not send or receive data. these are only for powering your DMG**

name: Replacement battery covers (ALL MODELS)
description:
These are reproduction replacement battery covers for various models of the Game Boy.
They fit perfectly like the standard battery covers and the color matching is great!

Options:
-Loomis x Kitsch-Bent DMG
-Original grey DMG
-Game Boy Color(CGB)
-Game Boy Pocket(MGB)
-Game Boy Advance(AGB)

name: LEDx3 backlight panel
description: these are LED backlights for the nintendo game boy DMG and Pocket consoles.† the current version is variant c (VC). this backlight features: 3 LEDs for uniform light distribution (bottom-illuminated) 1.4mm thickness installs to a regulated power source resistors specific to the LED color available in either normal or inverted polarization reinforced hookup wire solder joints built-in resistors built-in polarization film RoHS compliant installation documentation:†† PDF http://images.kitsch-bent.com/documentation/LEDx3_VB_ver1.pdf IMPORTANT! all backlight variations install slightly different than other kits that are available and from each other. please read the documentation before your order, and especially before doing your installation ;) be warned, the pocket's LCD screen is very fragile, more so than that of the DMG. keep this in mind when removing the polarization film. also, the pocket's LCD reacts oppositely to the polarization film you order. if you want your screen to look 'normal' you will need 'inverted' film. for the screen to look 'inverted' please order a kit with 'normal' film. †† this documentation is made for (vb). the (vc) kit is the same as the (vb) kit, apart from an updated LED PCB within the backlight. the wires coming from the backlight are in a reversed order than those of (vb). this doesn't affect which color wire is soldered during installation, it only mean you no longer need to cross the wires during installation, making it cleaner to install. follow the instructions for the (vb) kit, paying attention to the color of the wire you are soldering. when in doubt, the black wire is ground, the colored wire is 5V.

name: Hex Switch v2
description:
The newest version of the Hex Switch!
While this kit is a little bit bigger(only 3/8" x 3/8") than the original Hex Switch, the installation has been drastically simplified.
You now only need an on/off switch with two wires to change the polarization of the LCD. Hex Switch v1 requires 6 wires just for the switch.

You can purchase this kit in two different ways: 
-DIY kit: Assembled PCB only.
-Full kit: Assembled PCB, on/off toggle switch and enough wire to install.

Installation:
Simply match up In, Out, V(5v) and G(Ground) pins on the PCB to the pads on your Game Boy as shown in the 3rd and 4th/5th pictures. Then solder your on/off switch to the n/i(normal/inverted) pins for polarization control.

name: DMG Audio
description:
This is a replacement board for the Original Game Boy(DMG) headphone jack. 
With all new components this is a perfect way to replace the old worn out capacitors and save space for other mods.

You can purchase this kit in two different ways: 
-Basic kit: PCB with components only(no headphone jack). You will need to remove your original headphone jack and install it in the board.
-Full kit: Assembled PCB and includes an original headphone jack installed.

Easy to install. Desolder the wires and headphone jack from the original headphone PCB and solder them to the new headphone board in the same order.
 
You can also use the DMG Audio as an internal prosound by only soldering the right two wires(ground and switch) as they originally were and soldering left and right to the volume pot.

name: DMG Test Cartridge
description: This is the original ROM that Nintendo used to test every Game Boy before they left the factory. We use them to test every Game Boy we get before and after we mod them. If you buy Game Boys at thrift shops or online you need this cart to make sure every aspect of the Game Boy works. No need to waste your expensive flash cartridge to use this program. This is a standalone cartridge for the low price of $15. Circuit board(PCB) is black. Case comes in 3 colors: Clear. Clear blue. Clear orange. Clear case, yellow PCB. Check out the demo video here: DMG Test Cart Demo video DMG Test ROM dumped and PCBs by Kitsch-Bent

name: Music Tech Cartridge
description: This program is fantastic! Music Tech v2 turns your Game Boy into a live keyboard! Adjust your parameters, key and octave then press start. Now each button on your Game Boy sounds a note of a full scale allowing you to play leads, bass lines and more! No need to waste your expensive flash cartridge to use this program. This is a standalone cartridge for the low price of $15. Circuit board(PCB) is black. Case comes in 3 colors: Clear. Clear blue. Clear orange. Check out the demo video here: Music Tech Demo video PCBs by Kitsch-Bent

name: RGB Switches
description:
This kit can be used to control RGB LED kits such as the Kitsch-bent backlight, RGBss and Case LEDs. 

These three push button switches easily mount to the top of a DMG case to to turn on and off red, green and blue to make up to 7 colors.

Included in kit:
RGB switches PCB with 3 push buttons installed.
3 black button caps.
2 screws.
2 spacers.

You can also add an RGB backlight which will include resistor board and polarizer film for an additional $10.

Installation guide is in the last picture(save the image for higher quality).

name: Built-to-order Game Boy
description: This item page is only a reference on how you can order a custom Game Boy right on the website. Please do NOT add this item to your cart. You can add a backlit Original Game Boy(DMG), backlit Game Boy Pocket(MGB) or front lit Game Boy Color(CGB) to your cart. Choose the shell(case) color in the drop down menu. You can also send in your own Game Boy to be modified. Please contact us through the contact form on this website. Then you can add any modifications to your Game Boy by adding it to your cart. After adding your Game Boy to your cart, please go to the appropriate page for a list of compatible modifications: DMG: Modifications and parts for the the Original Game Boy. MGB: Modifications and parts for the the Game Boy Pocket. CGB: Modifications and parts for the the Game Boy Color. AGB: Parts for the the Game Boy Advance. At this time we are only offering front light mods and screen covers for the AGB. We apologize for the inconvenience. Choose the option "Installed" in the drop down menu on any kit and it will be installed in the Game Boy that you have chosen. All you need to do is enter the backlight color and polarization(normal or inverted) you would like in the comments box on PayPal when confirming your order. Not all modifications are listed on the website. Scroll down for a complete list. If you would like more mods than what is listed then you will need to e-mail us at justin@thursdaycustoms.com and we will get you a quote right away. Once we finalize exactly what you will be getting I will put a unique item on the shop so you can order it securely through the website. This is a list of Game Boys we offer and their prices: Grey DMG (Original Grey Game Boy): $25 Red DMG:$30 Green DMG: $30 Yellow DMG: $35 Clear DMG: $45 Black DMG: $50 MGB (standard colors): $35 CGB (standard colors): $35 Game Boy Advance (standard colors): $35 ** every Game Boy we sell comes with a brand new screen cover ** This is a list of ALL modifications. If you do not see something here that you would like please feel free to email us. Backlight(DMG and MGB ONLY) : $35($40 for MGB) (included when purchasing a DMG or MGB) Frontlight(CGB and AGB ONLY): $40 (included when ordering a CGB or AGB) Bivert: $15 Bivert switch: $30 On/off switch for backlight: $10 RGB switches: $25 Internal "Pro-sound": $10 1/8" pro sound: $15 RCA prosound: $20 1/4" prosound: $25 Backlit start and select buttons: $25 Case LEDs (clear DMG only) Half/normal clock speed switch: $25 Variable Clock speed with on/off switch: $30 ($35 with low speed limiter) Start pedal jack: $30 PS2 socket for LSDJ keyboard: $25 Original or Play-It-Loud buttons: $FREE NES or SNES buttons: $5 Kitsch-Bent buttons: $4 Kitsch-Bent Batt_DMG: $25 ASM PCB mount prosound board: $30 ASM custom colored screen covers: $5 http://asmretro.com/diy-gear/gameboy-screen-covers ASM custom buttons: $4 Too make is easier just copy and paste the options you would like when you email us at: JUSTIN@THURSDAYCUSTOMS.COM ** some modifications link to external websites. these links are for reference only since we use and sell other products. ** ** some modifications have no links. these are mods you will need to email us to get. **

The the built-in frontlight this Game Boy becomes the ultimate night-time retro gaming machine! You can also see the LCD just fine in full light.
You can play Original Game Boy, Game Boy Color and Game Boy Advance games on this console.

Great, gently used condition.
Battery cover included.
Brand new screen cover.

Choose from these shell colors:

Black

name: Phillips screwdriver
description: The perfect size for the internal screws of Game Boys and other small devices.

name: Tri-wing screwdriver
description: The perfect tool for opening your Nintendo Game Boy case.

name: Hex DMG
description:
This is a simple break out board for a dual inverter IC. 
This can be used to "bi-vert" your Original Game Boy(DMG). 
Bi-version gives you a much sharper contrast for your backlit LCD. 
It will however be more difficult to see in full daylight.

This kit measures 13mm x 8mm wide and 3mm tall.

You can purchase this as: 
"Full kit": Comes with 4 pins and 2 wires. 
"Installed": When you order a Backlit DMG-01 it will be installed in that Game Boy.

Installation instructions are in the 2nd picture.

name: Hex v1.3
description:
This is a simple break out board for a dual inverter IC(included and assembled).
This can be used to "bi-vert" your Original Game Boy(DMG) or Game Boy Pocket(MGB). Bi-version gives you a much sharper contrast for your backlit LCD. It will however be more difficult to see in full daylight.

This kit measures 7mm x 8mm wide and 3mm tall.

You can purchase this as: 
"PCB Only": Supply your own wire. 
"Full DIY Kit": Comes with enough wire to install it into a Game Boy. 
"Installed": When you order a Backlit DMG-01 or Backlit Game Boy Pocket and it will be installed in that Game Boy.

Installation instructions:
If you want a "bi-verted" LCD make sure that your backlit LCD has the polarizer installed in the inverted position. When you install the Hex v1.3 your LCD will have a normal color palette in a much sharper contrast.
This can make the LCD more difficult to see in full daylight.

Or you can simply use the Hex v1.3 with a normal LCD and this will give you an inverted image that is much easier to see in full daylight.

Cut the two traces shown precisely where the thin ride line is in the 3rd photo.

Solder 6 wires at about 2"(50mm) long to each pin on the Hex v1.2.
You may want to color code them with different colored wires so you don't mix up your lines. 

Check the 1st and 3rd pictures.
Solder:
Ground to Ground
5V to 5V
In 1 to In 1
In 2 to In 2
Out 1 to Out 1
Out 2 to Out 2
You may want to use a little hot glue so your wires don't break. Wrap the board in electrical tape and tuck it up in the top behind the main PCB.
That's it!

name: Hex Switch
description:
This kit allows you to change the color pallet of an original Game Boy(DMG) LCD with the flip of a switch or the push of a button.
You can either mount a push button switch directly to the PCB or use a toggle switch and place it elsewhere.

You can purchase this as: 
"Basic kit" supply your own wire and switch.
"Full kit(push switch)" comes with enough wire and a push button switch switch(3rd picture).
"Full kit(toggle switch)" comes with enough wire and a toggle switch switch(4th picture).
"Installed" when you order a Backlit DMG-01.

Installation guide is in the 5th picture.

Check out this video:
<iframe width="420" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/kakpol7Sjdk" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Sub Mini DPDT Metal Toggle Switch
description:
These are perfect for the Hex Switch kits. They would also go great for 
This is a sub-mini switch and will work for most Game Boys given the proper placement.

Double pole, double throw.

You will need a 3/16" drill bit to install this into your device.

name: Variable Clock v0
description:
The smallest version in the "Variable Clock" family!
Measuring about 7/16"(10mm) long x 5/16"(9mm) wide x 1/4"(7mm) thick!

This is a variable clock output device. 
You can manipulate the speed of the Game Boy processor on the fly with a potentiometer.
The pitch of the sound will become lower as you slow it down and it will become higher when you speed it up.
You can make some incredible sounds with this kit as well as adding a whole new way to play games!

You can purchase this as: 
"Basic kit" supply your own wire, switch, potentiometer and knob. 
"Full kit" includes a sub-mini SPDT toggle switch, a micro potentiometer, knob and enough wire to install it into a Game Boy.
"Installed" when you order a DMG-01 or Pocket and it will be installed in that Game Boy.

Installation instructions are in the last picture. 
Save the image for higher quality.
A printed version comes with every order!

name: Variable Clock v1
description:
This is a variable clock output device. 
You can manipulate the speed of the Game Boy processor on the fly with a potentiometer.
The pitch of the sound will become lower as you slow it down and it will become higher when you speed it up.
You can make some incredible sounds with this kit as well as adding a whole new way to play games!

Built in features:
-High limiter:
This will limit how fast it will go. Many devices will crash if pushed too far. 
A 10K SMD resistor is pre-soldered for installation into an Original Game Boy(DMG) or Game Boy Pocket(MGB).
It can easily be removed with a razor blade and you may install a different through hole resistor(an 8K resistor is ideal for the Game Boy Color(CGB).

-Low Limiter:
With a 100k-500K pot(higher resistance = lower speed and pitch) this kit will go so slow and low that the LCD will not be visible and the notes will sound like a droning "growl"(this can actually be a very awesome effect for music). 
You can solder a resistor to the through hole "Low Limiter" pads and this will only allow the kit to go as slow as you like.
A 100k-150k resistor is recommended.
If you would like to change the low limit in an easier way please check out the Variable Clock v3 or v4.

You can purchase this as: 
"Basic kit" supply your own wire, switch, potentiometer and knob. 
"Full kit" includes a sub-mini SPDT toggle switch, a micro potentiometer, knob and enough wire to install it into a Game Boy.
"Installed" when you order a DMG-01, Pocket or Color and it will be installed in that Game Boy.

Installation instructions are in the last picture. 
Save the image for higher quality.
A printed version comes with every order!

The assembled V1.3 PCB and components measures approximately 5/8"(15mm) long x 3/8"(10mm) wide x 3/32"(2.5mm) thick.

name: Variable Clock v2
description: Working on a new revision!

name: Variable Clock v3
description:
This is a variable clock output device. 
You can manipulate the speed of the Game Boy processor on the fly with a potentiometer.
The pitch of the sound will become lower as you slow it down and it will become higher when you speed it up.
You can make some incredible sounds with this kit as well as adding a whole new way to play games!

Built in features:
-Panel mounting:
This kit can be mounted directly the Game Boy case with the provided screws and spacer.

-High limiter:
This will limit how fast it will go. Many devices will crash if pushed too far. 
A 10K SMD resistor is pre-soldered for installation into an Original Game Boy(DMG) or Game Boy Pocket(MGB).
It can easily be removed with a razor blade and you may install a different through hole resistor(an 8K resistor is ideal for the Game Boy Color(CGB).

-Low Limiter: 
With a 100k-500K pot(higher resistance = lower speed and pitch) this kit will go so slow and low that the LCD will not be visible and the notes will sound like a droning "growl"(this can actually be a very awesome effect for music). 
The VCv3.4 comes with a 200K trim pot pre-installed. This will allow you to set the low limit before you install the kit or you can install it at the top or side of an Original Game Boy(DMG) and the low limiter can be accessed through a small hole with a screw driver so that it can be adjusted on the fly. 
Check out this video for a demonstration of how this feature works: 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gHV7cbHpcSU

You can purchase this as: 
"Basic kit" supply your own wire, switch, potentiometer and knob. 
"Full kit" includes a sub-mini SPDT toggle switch, a micro potentiometer, knob and enough wire to install it into a Game Boy.
"Installed" when you order a DMG-01, Pocket or Color and it will be installed in that Game Boy.

Installation instructions are in the last picture. 
Save the image for higher quality.
A printed version comes with every order!

The assembled V3.4 PCB and components measures approximately 1" x 3/8"(25mm) long x (9mm) wide x 1/4"(7mm) thick.

name: Variable Clock v4
description:
The most advanced version on the "Variable Clock" family!

This is a variable clock output device. 
You can manipulate the speed of the Game Boy processor on the fly with a potentiometer.
The pitch of the sound will become lower as you slow it down and it will become higher when you speed it up.
You can make some incredible sounds with this kit as well as adding a whole new way to play games!

Built in features:
-On/off push button switch:
No need to get a separate switch for this kit. It is built right into the PCB!

-Panel mounting:
This kit should be mounted directly the Game Boy case with the provided screws and spacer.

-High limiter:
This will limit how fast it will go. Many devices will crash if pushed too far. 
A 10K SMD resistor is pre-soldered for installation into an Original Game Boy(DMG) or Game Boy Pocket(MGB).
It can easily be removed with a razor blade and you may install a different through hole resistor(an 8K resistor is ideal for the Game Boy Color(CGB).

-Low Limiter: 
With a 100k-500K pot(higher resistance = lower speed and pitch) this kit will go so slow and low that the LCD will not be visible and the notes will sound like a droning "growl"(this can actually be a very awesome effect for music). 
The VCv4.5 comes with a 200K trim pot pre-installed. This will allow you to set the low limit before you install the kit or you can install it at the top or side of an Original Game Boy(DMG) and the low limiter can be accessed through a small hole with a screw driver so that it can be adjusted on the fly. 
Check out this video for a demonstration of how this feature works: 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gHV7cbHpcSU

You can purchase this as: 
"Basic kit" supply your own wire, switch, potentiometer and knob. 
"Full kit" includes a sub-mini SPDT toggle switch, a micro potentiometer, knob and enough wire to install it into a Game Boy.
"Installed" when you order a DMG-01, Pocket or Color and it will be installed in that Game Boy.

Installation instructions are in the last picture. 
Save the image for higher quality.
A printed version comes with every order!

The assembled V4.5 PCB and components measures approximately 1 1/4"(25mm) long x 3/8"(9mm) wide x 1/4"(7mm) thick.

name: 250K miniature potentiometer
description:
The perfect pot to go along with the Variable Clock DIY kits. Audio taper for a perfect transition of sound rather than the sharp high and low of the common linear tapered pots. 
Comes with washer and nut for panel mounting. 
You will need a 5/8" drill bit to install this into your device.

name: Assorted Knobs
description:
We have many different knobs in stock.
Check the pictures for which # you want and choose the # in the drop down option before adding to your cart.

Dimensions:
Knob #1: 14mm wide x 14mm tall. 1/4" shaft hole. 1.5mm allen key mounting screw.
Knob #2: 20mm wide x 12mm tall. 1/4" shaft hole. Flat head mounting screw.
Knob #3: 14mm wide x 18mm tall. 1/4" shaft hole. Press on tight mounting.

***these knobs will not fit on the micro pots for Variable Clocks v3 and v4***

name: Colorful Knob for Variable Clock
description: **This knob will NOT fit the pot on Variable Clock v3 or v4** **This knob will NOT fit the pot on Variable Clock v3 or v4** **This knob will NOT fit the pot on Variable Clock v3 or v4** These knobs come in 12 different colors. They are for a 1/4" shaft and will fit these pots perfectly: 250k pot They will fit the pots that come with Variable Clock v0, v1 and v2 full DIY kits. A small flat head screwdriver is all you need to tighten the knob to the pot. **This knob will NOT fit the pot on Variable Clock v3 or v4** **This knob will NOT fit the pot on Variable Clock v3 or v4** **This knob will NOT fit the pot on Variable Clock v3 or v4**

name: Micro Pot & Knob Kit
description:
This tiny little 200k potentiometer will fit just about anywhere in an original Game Boy.

A small knob is also included because the 1/8" shaft size makes it difficult to find knobs that will fit.

Check the photos to see a size comparison to the standard sized pots we also sell.

The box of the pot measures 10mm x 10mm wide and 5mm tall
The knob measures 11mm wide x 12mm tall.

name: Case LEDs v1.1
description:
Have you ever wanted your CLEAR Game Boy to GLOW? Now it can and it's never been easier! With this kit you will get two assembled PCBs each with two LEDs(total of 4 LEDs). These LEDs are 5mm diffused RGB LEDs. You can make up to 7 different colors: Red Green Blue Yellow =Red+Green Cyan =Green+Blue Pink =Blue+Red White =Red+Blue+Green You can can choose to have one solid color permanently or you can can install 3 switches to turn red, green and blue off individually to choose between these 7 colors on the fly: thursdaycustoms.bigcartel.com/product/on-on-metal-toggle-switch This kit is 100% compatible with the Kitsch-Bent.com RGB backlights: kitsch-bent.com/product/rgbbb and the RGBva controller: kitsch-bent.com/product/rgbva *but not both at the same time* Installation instructions: The board is preassembled so all you will need is some wire. The pins are labeled R, G, B and V. Solder pin V to the 5v source on your Game Boy. Depending on your color choice solder R, G and B or more to the ground source on your Game Boy. If you want to install switches simply wire one side of all three switches together and connect this to ground. Then solder R, G and B individually to the other pin of the switches. And just for fun!
make animated gifs like this at MakeAGif

name: RGBss Backlit Start & Select buttons
description:
A collaborative project with kitsch-bent.com This is a kit which adds RGB LED illumination and color-control ability to the start and select buttons of the Game Boy original console(DMG).
Check first 3 pictures for installations guides.

Features:
0.6mm PCB thickness.
Two RGB LEDs.
Solder points for use with Kitsch-Bent RGBbb backlight.
Solder points for independent RGB control.
Easy to install!
Hand-assembled and fully tested.
New LEDs for true green. Perfectly mixed colors.

You can purchase this as:
"PCB Only" Kit includes: Clear silicon start/select buttons. RGBss circuit board supply your own wire and switches(if desired).
"Full DIY Kit" which will come with 3 SPDT metal toggle switches and enough wire to install it into a DMG.
"Installed" when you order a Backlit DMG-01 and it will of course be installed in that Game Boy. Please enter in the PayPal comments what color/colors you would like.
Kit includes:
Clear silicon start/select buttons.
RGBss circuit board.

name: Triple Pro-sounder v1.1
description:
This is a simple audio splitter intended for installing multiple pro-sound mods into a Game Boy. It can be fairly difficult to solder multiple wires to one point.
You can use this to install up to 3 different pro-sound jacks into your Original Game Boy(DMG).

This panel measures approximately 3/8" x 1/2" (8mm x 14mm) wide and 1/16" (1.6mm) thick.

Installation instructions:
There are four set of three through-hole solder pads. Choose any one of these sets of three and solder wires to the pads(you may want to color code them with 3 different colored wires so you don't mix up your lines).
Check the 2nd picture. Solder G to Ground.
If you want volume control then solder L and R to Left and Right(post pot).
If you do NOT want volume control and a slightly louder signal then solder L and R to Left and Right(pre pot).
From here you can can solder an 1/8" jack, a quarter jack and RCAs for installing into your DMG!

*this will work with any Game Boy or any other audio device with similar hook ups. you may not be able to fit this panel as well as other jacks into the smaller Game Boys"

name: 1/8" Pro-Sound kit
description:
This is a high quality stereo 1/8" panel mount jack. 
Perfect for a pro-sound mod!

You can order this as:
"Jack Only" and you will just get the 1/8" jack.
"Full kit" and it will be prewired and sealed with hot-glue for you to install into your Game Boy.
"Installed" and it will be installed into the Game Boy you have added to your cart.
This will work in The original Game Boy (DMG), Game Boy Pocket(MGB), Game Boy Color (CGB) and Super Game Boy(SGB).

White wire = Left
Red wire = Right
Black wire = Ground

Installation guide is the last picture.

name: RCA Pro-Sound kit
description:
This includes 2 panel mounting RCA jacks(one for left signal, one for right signal). 
Perfect for a pro-sound mod!

You can order this as:
"2 RCA Jacks Only" and you will just get 2 RCA jack.
"Full kit" and it will include enough wire for you to install into your Game Boy.
"Installed" and it will be installed into the Game Boy you have added to your cart.

This will work in The original Game Boy (DMG), Game Boy Pocket(MGB) and Game Boy Color (CGB).

A 1/4" drill bit will be needed to install this into your device.

name: 1/4" Pro-Sound kit
description:
This is a high quality stereo 1/4" jack. 
Perfect for a pro-sound mod!

You can order this as:
"Jack Only" and you will just get the 1/4" jack.
"Full DIY Kit" and it will be prewired and sealed with hot-glue for you to install into your Game Boy.
"Installed" and it will be installed into the Game Boy you have added to your cart.

This will work in The original Game Boy (DMG).

The shaft measures 7/16".

As there is no room for a nut and washer inside a Game Boy you will need to glue this in place(i recommend hot glue).

Blue wire = Left
Red wire = Right
White wire = Ground
Or:
White wire = Left
Red wire = Right
Black wire = Ground

*Even though this is a stereo jack you can still wire it up as mono jack. you can order two of these and wire one for the left signal and one for the right signal*

name: Half clock switch
description:
**This is ONLY for adding to a backlit DMG or Pocket** 
Please do not order unless you want it to be installed in a DMG or Pocket that you have added to your cart. 

I use the kitsch-bent easy_CLK kit for this mod. 
More info can be found here:
http://images.kitsch-bent.com/documentation/easy_CLK_english.pdf
A metal toggle switch will be installed for operation of this kit.

name: Mini Rocker On/Off switch
description:
This is a simple on/off black rocker switch.
It fits well in the top or side of an Original Game Boy(DMG).
You will need to cut a square hole roughly 9mm x 19mm.
Outside dimensions are 11mm x 15mm.

name: Sub Mini SPDT Metal Toggle Switch
description:
These are perfect for the Variable Clock kits or for switching your backlight on and off. They would also go great for RGB backlights to turn on/off red, green, and blue individually(you will need 3 switches for this).
This is a sub-mini switch and will fit in most Game Boys given the proper placement.

Single pole, double throw. This means the switch has two on positions(middle pin is common) but can be used for on/off applications.

There are 3 order options:
"1 toggle switch" is one switch by itself with 2 hex nuts and washers.
"Backlight on/off installed" when ordering a backlit DMG you can add this item to be able to turn your backlight on and off.
"Three toggle switches" get 3 switches at once for $1 off!

You will need a 3/16" drill bit to install this into your device.

*this will not work for the Hex Switch DIY kit. You need a double pole switch for this*

name: Classic Screen Protectors (ALL MODELS)
description:
These are replacement screen covers for:
Original Game Boy (DMG). Light and dark grey.
Game Boy Pocket (MGB).
Game Boy Color (CGB).

They have an adhesive back and a protective film on the front.
To install simply remove your old screen protector then remove the paper cover on the back of the new protector. Then remove the protective film on the front(optional since this protects your screen protector!).

name: Plain CGB screen cover
description:
A simple dark grey screen cover for the Game Boy Color.
Adhesive on the back and protective film on the front.

name: Blue Game Boy Advance Screen Cover
description:
A nice blue after market screen cover for the Game Boy Advance.
These were intended to be placed over the original screen cover. That is why you see the blank rectangle at the bottom. The Nintendo logo would show through this. You can use it on it's own and write or print out a cool design behind it for a unique look!

name: Super Game Boy POCKET(SGBP)
description: This is a Super Game Boy cartridge for playing your original Game Boy games on the Super Nintendo(SNES). It has been modified to fit in a regular sized SNES game cart shell. Color options are: Grey. Red. Black These shells are not dyed or painted but are stock shells made by Nintendo. You can add mods from the Super Game Boy page like: -1/8" pro-sound -Variable Clock Choose "Installed" before adding to your cart. Then they will be installed into your Game Boy. *DISCLAIMER* These units are made-to-order. Please allow 2-3 weeks for the item to be assembled. Shipping is then 2-3 business days in the US and 6-10 business days international(though they can sometimes be delayed in customs so please be patient. Feel free to contact me if this time frame has passed).

name: Super Game Boy for SNES
description: The classic Game Boy player cartridge for the Super Nintendo. You can add mods from the Super Game Boy page like: -1/8" pro-sound -Variable Clock Choose "Installed" before adding to your cart. Then they will be installed into your Super Game Boy. *DISCLAIMER* These units are made-to-order. Please allow 2-3 weeks for the item to be assembled. Shipping is then 2-3 business days in the US and 6-10 business days international(though they can sometimes be delayed in customs so please be patient. Feel free to contact me if this time frame has passed).

name: ASM Buttons
description: With 14 different different color choices, these buttons can replace your worn DMG, *NES or *SNES buttons! Specifications: Machine casted Casted in high quality ABS material to assure durability. Color matching to match Game Boy shell colors, screen covers, and more! Compatible with DMG Game Boys, *NES controllers, and **SNES Controllers *The DMG's Dpad is a little smaller than the NES's d-pad, and therefore will be a looser fit inside of an NES controller, but it will work. **The d-pad will not fit into a SNES controller, but the two circular buttons will. However, the response will different from genuine buttons due to some subtle differences. ***If you have added a DMG to you cart and order a set of these they will be installed in that Game Boy. If you do not want them installed or have purchased more than one set please specify in the check out comments box! Click these thumb nails for buttons colors:

name: Kitsch-Bent Buttons
description:
**This is ONLY when you order a Backlit DMG, MGB or CGB**
I DO NOT sell these on their own. 
Choose from the available color and model options here:
http://store.kitsch-bent.com/product/custom-buttons
and then enter in the PayPal notes/comments which color you would like and in which Game Boy.

If you would like to purchase a set for yourself please go to this link:
http://store.kitsch-bent.com/product/custom-buttons

name: Utility
description: Random stuff for secure transactions
